item.title: 2 vans parked on single yellow line, 1st March
item.description:
2 white vans parked on single yellow no parking line Been there a few weeks One is parked opposite a junction and the other is parked on a blind turn so both are making it dangerous to drive up the road Second time Iv had to report this incident now
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): James Way, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cones left behind, 1st March
item.description:
A large number of traffic cones are on both sides of the road between the top of the hill westbound from Seven Springs and the Andoversford turnoff. They have been there for months. Recent roadworks went up in the middle of the abandoned ones and wisdom would have dictated them being taken away once the roadworks were completed. No, they were left behind again. No pictures as I was driving.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: 3 potholes in a line, 1st March
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Montpellier Villas, Montpellier, Cheltenham

item.title: Vespa graffiti tags on service boxes, 1st March
item.description:
Vespa tag on service boxes. This particular tag is all along Gloucester Road and the Honeybourne line so I wonder whether we can catch the culprit with the cameras down the Honeybourne line? Clean a wall of graffiti on the Honeybourne near a camera and wait.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Hatherley Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This sign has been replaced with the wrong one. It should have the arrows pointing vertically to indicate 2-way traffic straight ahead (not 2-way traffic crossing). Also it should face directly south down North Street, 28th February

item.title: Pavement falling apart, 28th February
item.description:
The pavement needs mending please - it's breaking up in places meaning it's very difficult to push a wheelchair or pushchair over, and it's in a really bad state.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Pilley Lane, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: There are numerous pot holes due to water erosion caused by run off. Can’t avoid pot hole as either side of the carriage way and also a danger to cyclists, 28th February
item.description:
From Tir Conail house all the way down to church road. Please fill the holes and investigate the water run off as the road is like a constant stream/ river. The potholes have been getting worse over the last few months but now it is dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crippetts Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole outside school entrance, 28th February

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
